alert.note: Alert for Cass; Mason (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 5:23PM CST until further notice by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Sangamon River near Chandlerville affecting Cass and Mason Counties. .An ice jam will cause water to infiltrate the lowlands along the river. .The following forecasts are based on observed precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and forecast precipitation. The ice jam upstream of Chandlerville has been reported to be on the move, as indicated by the recent drop in stage at Oakford. The stage at Chandlerville is rising quickly as upstream water and ice quickly move through. Stages have already been elevated due to some ice or debris conditions downstream of Chandlerville. The rise in stage can be considerable if the dislodged ice causes a new or enhanced jam at Chandlerville or downstream. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. An ice jam upstream near Oakford may result in the stage rapidly rising if the ice jam releases. * WHERE...Sangamon River near Chandlerville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 459.9 feet, Flooding begins to impact some residences in Chandlerville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 PM CST Friday the stage was 459.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 PM CST Friday was 459.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 460.0 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 456.6 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Sangamon River Chandlerville 456.6 459.8 Fri 5 pm CST 460.0 460.0 459.7 &&
info.instruction: Persons with interests along this river need to remain aware of the latest forecasts and associated flood risk for their area. Stay tuned for further updates on this flooding situation. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
